qas.question: When did the Mature Indus Civilization thrive?
What stage of civilization did the Mature Indus represent?
What kind of organization did the Mature Indus have?
Of what were the early cities of the Mature Indus civilization built?
How high were the buildings in the Mature Indus ?

context: The Mature Indus civilisation flourished from about <a0_0>2600 to 1900 BCE<a0_0/>, marking the beginning of <a1_0>urban<a1_0/> civilisation on the subcontinent. The civilisation included urban centres such as Dholavira, Kalibangan, Ropar, Rakhigarhi, and Lothal in modern-day India, as well as Harappa, Ganeriwala, and Mohenjo-daro in modern-day Pakistan. The civilisation is noted for its cities built of <a3_0>brick<a3_0/>, roadside drainage system, and <a4_0>multistoreyed<a4_0/> houses and is thought to have had some kind of <a2_0>municipal<a2_0/> organization.
